title: Africa: World Malaria Day 2024 - 'Accelerating the Fight Against Malaria for a More Equitable World'

description: [Oxfam] Today's "Global Report on Food Crises" (GRFC), led by the Food Security Information Network (FSIN), says that 281.6 million people across 59 countries are now experiencing acute hunger - 24 million additional people over last year.
title: Africa: Oxfam Reaction to the Global Report On Food Crises 2024

description: [IPS] New York -- Spearheaded by the Museum for the United Nations, a new campaign brings together music and ecology to spark people's interest and engagement in environmental conservation through consciously listening to music.
title: Africa: 'Toasting the World's Most Natural Talent' - UN Museum Campaign Recognizes Nature's Contributions to Music

description: [IPS] Apex, North Carolina / Dublin, Ireland -- What makes an effective UN Secretary-General?
title: Africa: Skills and Attributes The Next UN Leader Needs

description: [ISS] With their leading roles regionally and in the G20 and COP30, a Brazil-South Africa partnership could prompt useful south-south ties.
title: Africa: Time Is Right for a South Atlantic Climate Alliance

description: [allAfrica] AllAfrica Global Media is launching the AllAfrica Media Leaders' Summit from May 8-10 in Nairobi, Kenya. The Summit will feature innovations to leverage the ever-changing media landscape revolutionized by emerging technologies like artificial intelligence and virtual reality.  Global media leaders, development experts, academics and corporate titans will share best practices to elevate ethics and combat information manipulation to advance Africa's economic transformation and human
title: Africa: Innovations at the AllAfrica Media Leaders' Summit

description: [UN News] Top UN officials launched a fresh global campaign to tackle the climate emergency on Tuesday, with social media influencers, Indigenous leaders and corporate giants showing what they've done and what's to come.
title: Africa: UN Chief Calls for All Hands On Deck At Climate Promise 2025 Launch

description: [New Times] In a strong call to stakeholders at the opening of the tenth Africa Regional Forum on Sustainable Development (ARFSD-10) in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia, Amina Mohammed, the UN Deputy Secretary-General on April 23 said that urgent action is needed to increase capital flows into developing countries, particularly in Africa to make the SDGs stimulus a reality. She also urged the international community to support Africa in its efforts to deliver its vision for development through the SDGs 2030 agenda and Agenda
title: Africa: Strong Calls for Innovative Financing, Reform of International Financial System to Achieve SDGs in Africa

description: [New Times] African Union (AU) Commission Chairperson Moussa Faki Mahamat has expressed serious concern about the escalating challenges of terrorism and violent extremism affecting the African continent, Xinhua reports.
title: Africa: AU Chief Warns of Rising Terrorism Threats in Africa

description: [The Conversation Africa] Nestlé has been criticised for adding sugar and honey to infant milk and cereal products sold in many poorer countries. The Swiss food giant controls 20% of the baby-food market, valued at nearly US$70 billion.
title: Africa: Sugar in Baby Food - Why Nestlé Needs to Be Held to Account in Africa

description: [IPS] Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia -- Rich nations' climate hypocrisy is accelerating global heating, pushing the planet closer to irreversible catastrophe, with its worst consequences borne by the poorest, both countries and peoples.
title: Africa: Rich Nation Hypocrisy Accelerating Global Heating

description: [UN Women] UN Women Goodwill Ambassador, award-winning playwright and actor Danai Gurira has delivered today powerful  remarks at the UN Security Council  during the annual open debate on conflict-related sexual violence. The debate, organized under the Malta Presidency of the Security Council, focused this year on preventing conflict-related sexual violence through demilitarization and gender-responsive arms control.
title: Africa: 'Until We Make it Clear There Are Consequences For Rape - Real, Dire consequences - We Will Never Turn the Tide of It'

description: [WHO] On this World Malaria Day 2024, we unite under the theme "Accelerating the fight against malaria for a more equitable world." This theme, which is in sync with this year's World Health Day theme ''My Health, My Right', underscores the urgent need to address the stark inequities that persist in access to malaria prevention, detection, and treatment services.
title: Africa: World Malaria Day 2024: 'Accelerating The Fight Against Malaria for a More Equitable World'

description: [Capital FM] Nairobi -- 21 African countries have enacted rules for non-resident suppliers to pay value-added tax (VAT) or goods and services tax (GST) on electronically supplied services.
title: Africa: 21 African Countries Enact Rules for Non-Resident Suppliers to Pay Vat Online

description: [VOA] United Nations -- Actor and U.N. Goodwill Ambassador Danai Gurira told diplomats Tuesday that finding a child to sexually abuse in a conflict zone can cost less than one dollar. She urged policymakers to curb the illicit flow of weapons as one way to prevent these crimes.
title: Africa: UN - Guns Fueling Rape of Children, Women in War Zones

description: [UN News] The UN verified 3,688 cases of rape and other sexual violence committed in war in 2023, a "dramatic increase" of 50 per cent over the previous year, the Security Council heard on Tuesday.
title: Africa: Silence the Guns, Amplify Women's Voices for Peace to End Rape in Wartime

description: [The Conversation Africa] Cities cover just 3% of the planet. But they emit 78% of all global greenhouse gas emissions, absorb 80% of final global energy (what consumers use) and consume 60% of clean drinking water.
title: Africa: Africa's Megacities Threatened By Heat, Floods and Disease - Urgent Action Is Needed to Start Greening and Adapt to Climate Change

description: [African Arguments] Restoring degraded forests is essential, but planting trees in rangelands is largely ineffective and often damaging.
title: Africa: Where Planting Trees in Africa Works and, Crucially, Doesn't
